message.content: This question requires some basic understanding of environmental conservation and sustainability. Option (B) is the correct answer because taking shorter showers would conserve water, which is an important resource. Leaving lights on (option A) wastes electricity, which has a negative impact on the environment. Using Styrofoam plates (option C) is not environmentally friendly because Styrofoam is not biodegradable and contributes to pollution. Taking longer showers (option D) would waste more water, which is not sustainable.

This question requires knowledge about environmentally friendly actions. Taking shorter showers is a common recommendation for conserving water and reducing water usage, which has a positive impact on the environment. Leaving lights on (option A) actually wastes energy and is not environmentally friendly. Using Styrofoam plates (option C) is harmful to the environment as Styrofoam is not biodegradable. Taking longer showers (option D) increases water usage and is not environmentally friendly.  So, option (B) is the correct answer in this case.

Option (A) is incorrect because leaving lights on waste energy. Option (C) is incorrect because Styrofoam plates are not biodegradable and contribute to pollution. Option (D) is incorrect because taking longer showers uses more water, which is not environmentally friendly.
